page.title: 18 A Woodland near Strelley
page.content: {Chilwell Dam Plantation}is a small broadleaved wood which was probably set up about 1800 A.D when Thomas Webb Edge who lived at Strelley Hall replanted the woodland within his park to make the scenery more attractive and to conceal unpleasant features. The plantation stands on a site of old primary woodland and contains evidence that it was probably a coppice - standards plantation. The wood has not been managed for many years. As the underlying rock is Magnesian Limestone there is a rich ground flora in the wood including plants which show that long ago there was an ancient wood on this site. Some of these plants are Yellow Archangel, Bluebell, Cuckoo Pint, Wild Columbine, Wood Anemone, Wild Arum, Campanula species, Dogs' Mercury, Ramsons. A small stream flows through the wood.
